question: Is lucatumumab a polyclonal antibody?
ideal_answer: No, lucatumumab is a a monoclonal antibody against CD40.

snippets.text: A phase 1 study of lucatumumab, a fully human anti-CD40 antagonist monoclonal antibody administered intravenously to patients with relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma.
In this open-label, multicentre, phase 1 study a fully human anti-CD40 antagonist monoclonal antibody, lucatumumab, was evaluated in patients with relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma (MM).
